item.title: Bus owners mull co-based services amid decision to halt BRT project
item.description: Taking advantage of the government's decision to discontinue the BRT project on Gazipur-Airport route, bus owners want to operate company-managed bus services using the dedicated bus corridor. item.title: ACC summons docs on EBL chairman Showkat, family
item.description: The Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) has summoned detailed information from Eastern Bank PLC Chairman Md Showkat Ali Chowdhury and his family on their financial transactions, national identity documents, tax records, and other relevant papers as part of its investigation into allegations of irregul

item.title: RAB arrests two more 'top criminals' over Jubo Dal leader's murder
item.description: The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) arrested two more "top criminals" in the capital in connection with the murder of Golam Kibria, the member secretary of the Jubo Dal's Pallabi Thana unit. RAB-4 official Major Abrar Faisal Sadi said the arrestees are top criminals and alleged masterminds of the mur

item.title: ACC launches probe into Tk 3.32b loss to state for purchasing Rose Garden
item.description: The Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) has launched an investigation into the allegations that the state incurred a loss of Tk 3.32 billion in the name of purchasing the historic Rose Garden, known as the 'birthplace' of the Awami League (AL). Anyone found involved in irregularities during the inqui

item.title: Bangladesh can't progress without women’s safety online and offline: Tarique Rahman
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman on Thursday said Bangladesh cannot move forward unless women feel safe both online and offline, calling for urgent national action to protect and empower women in the digital age. “Women must feel safe. item.title: Trump signs bill approving Epstein files release
item.description: US President Donald Trump signed legislation on Wednesday ordering the Justice Department to release documents from its long-running investigation into sex offender Jeffrey Epstein — files eagerly sought by both his political opponents and members of his own base who have pressed for greater

item.title: Cambodia releases rare captive-bred storks in conservation breakthrough
item.description: Conservationists in Cambodia have for the first time released two captive-bred Greater Adjutant Stork chicks into the wild as part of an ongoing programme to revive a species under threat from poaching and habitat loss. The nine-month-old storks - a male and a female - were fitted with GPS tracker

item.title: Caretaker government key to fair elections: Amir Khosru
item.description: BNP Standing Committee Member Amir Khosru Mahmud Chowdhury on Thursday said that only a caretaker government can ensure a free and fair national election, welcoming the restoration of the system as a positive development. Speaking to reporters after an event at Dhaka University on Thursday morning

item.title: World's richest nations are pulling back from global development efforts: Study
item.description: Two dozen of the world's richest nations, including the United States and Japan, are pulling back from their global development push, a study published on Thursday, opens new tab shows, with many slashing aid budgets and cash funnelled through multilateral lenders. item.title: Bomb explodes outside ex-home minister’s Dhanmondi residence
item.description: A crude bomb has exploded in front of former home minister Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal’s residence on Dhanmondi Road No. 5 in Dhaka. Police confirmed the incident occurred shortly after 12:30 am on Thursday at the main gate of the house. Sub-Inspector Md Shahjalal of Dhanmondi Police Station tol

item.title: Indonesia evacuates stranded climbers after Semeru volcano erupts
item.description: Indonesian authorities evacuated more than 900 people and were facilitating the safe return on Thursday of 170 climbers stranded after the eruption of its Semeru volcano, one of the country's tallest mountains. The alert level was maintained at its highest after Semeru on Java island erupted 10 ti

item.title: Youth ‘commits suicide’ in Dhaka’s Hazaribagh
item.description: A 25-year-old youth was found dead after allegedly hanging himself from a ceiling fan at his residence in Hazaribagh of Dhaka on Thursday. The deceased was identified as Md Nazmul, son of Abul Bashar of Barguna Sadar upazila. He had been living with his family at a rented house in the Vaucher area
